    • Method Detail

      • getDecaying

        public boolean getDecaying()
        Getter method for whether the fireball is decaying
        Returns:
        boolean (true for decaying and hit an interactable object, false for not doing so)

      • setDecaying

        public void setDecaying(java.lang.Boolean d)
        Setter method for whether the fireball is decaying
        Parameters:
        d - boolean for whether the fireball is decaying or not

      • fireballHit

        public boolean fireballHit(App app)
        FireballHit is a method that evaluates whether the 'current' fireball considered has hit a valid destructable block on the map
        Parameters:
        app - app is used to get the ArrayList of all blocks (destructable and indestructable) that are to be drawn
        Returns:
        boolean corresponding to whether a destructable block that has not been destroyed has been hit by the current fireball

      • fireballHitGremlin

        public boolean fireballHitGremlin(App app)
        FireballHitGremlin is a method that evaluates whether the 'current' fireball considered has hit a gremlin mobile entity on the screen
        Parameters:
        app - app is used to get the ArrayList of all currently active gremlins that are to be drawn
        Returns:
        boolean corresponding to whether a valid gremlin has been hit by the current fireball.

      • draw

        public int draw(App app)
        Draw method to draw the fireball on screen
        Specified by:
        draw in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - inherits the image() method from PApplet

      • tick

        public int tick(App app)
        Tick method "updates" the fireball everytime called. Under the condition that the fireball is still "alive" - meaning it can still be displayed on the next frame and be considered for movement the tick method will check if it has collided with anything
        Specified by:
        tick in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - which is used in the mobile parent class to access all possible "collidable" objects
        Returns:
        integer 1 (corresponds to having hit something) or integer 0 (corresponds to not having hit something)
